channel.title: NYT > Top Stories
channel.copyright: Copyright 2022 The New York Times Company

item.title: As New Term Starts, Supreme Court Poised to Resume Rightward Push
item.description: The justices return to the bench on Monday to start a term that will include major cases on affirmative action, voting and discrimination against gay couples. Several will take on questions about race.
item.dc:creator: Adam Liptak
item.media:description: As president, Donald Trump appointed three justices to the Supreme Court, including Justice Amy Coney Barrett.

item.title: The Racial Divide Herschel Walker Couldn’t Outrun
item.description: As a teenage football prodigy, Mr. Walker was pressed to join a fight for civil rights in his hometown. His decision echoes decades later.
item.dc:creator: John Branch
item.media:description: Herschel Walker in 1979, when he was a high school football star, near the Johnson County Courthouse in Wrightsville, Ga., his hometown.

item.title: In Washington, Putin’s Nuclear Threats Stir Growing Alarm
item.description: In a gathering Cold War atmosphere, American officials are gaming out responses should Russia resort to battlefield nuclear weapons.
item.dc:creator: David E. Sanger, Anton Troianovski and Julian E. Barnes
item.media:description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia displayed on Friday on a screen in Moscow as he addressed the sham annexation of four regions of Ukraine.

item.title: ‘I Did All I Could’: As Floodwaters Rose, She Fought to Save Her Disabled Brothers
item.description: Darcy Bishop for decades has cared for her two brothers, who have cerebral palsy. Hurricane Ian was her biggest test yet.
item.dc:creator: Corina Knoll
item.media:credit: Jason Andrew for The New York Times
item.media:description: Darcy Bishop cleaned up her home after it flooded from Hurricane Ian in Naples, Fla.

item.title: Biden Will Visit Puerto Rico And Florida to Assess Storm Damage
item.description: Trips on Monday and Wednesday are planned to the sites of the natural disasters.
item.dc:creator: Michael D. Shear
item.media:credit: Kenny Holston for The New York Times
item.media:description: President Biden at the Federal Emergency Management Agency headquarters in Washington on Thursday. The agency’s administrator, Deanne Criswell, is at right.

item.title: Indonesian Fan Still Hears ‘Voices Screaming’ After Match
item.description: One witness said most of the victims were people trapped in the stands, not those on the field. Without tear gas “there would have not been any casualties,” he said.
item.dc:creator: Dera Menra Sijabat and Sui-Lee Wee
item.media:description: At the Kanjuruhan Stadium on Sunday.

item.title: Indonesian Soccer Tragedy Is Latest in History of Stadium Disasters
item.description: These events have prompted major changes. But fatal tramplings still occur, with more than 150 killed in Indonesia on Saturday.
item.dc:creator: Austin Ramzy
item.media:description: People fleeing tear gas at the Estadio Nacional in Lima on May 24, 1964.

item.title: American Prisoners Are Released From Venezuela and Iran
item.description: Caracas freed seven Americans in a trade for two nephews of Venezuela’s first lady who had been convicted on drug charges. Separately, Tehran released its longest-held American captive.
item.dc:creator: Michael D. Shear and Farnaz Fassihi
item.media:description: The Americans released by Venezuela included several executives of the Citgo oil refining company, who had been detained more than four years ago.

item.title: Anti-Vaccine Parents Go From Welcome to Ostracized in Marin County
item.description: The wealthy California county just north of San Francisco has one of the nation’s highest Covid-19 vaccination rates after years of being known for parents who opposed shots for childhood diseases.
item.dc:creator: Soumya Karlamangla
item.media:description: Karen Casas, 4, of Marin County receiving her first Covid-19 vaccine.

item.title: Leicester Tensions Have Roots in India
item.description: Violent confrontations in Leicester have prompted soul searching in an area long heralded as a success story of diversity and integration among its large Indian diaspora.
item.dc:creator: Megan Specia
item.media:credit: Andrew Testa for The New York Times
item.media:description: A predominantly Muslim area of Leicester, England. Experts say the tangles between mostly Hindu and Muslim men last month were only the latest examples of how toxic politics in India have migrated overseas.

item.title: The Not-So-Silent Friendship of Jason Mewes and Kevin Smith
item.description: The two, who have played the characters Jay and Silent Bob for 28 years and counting, reflect on their time as best friends and professional partners.
item.dc:creator: Robert Ito
item.media:credit: Adam Powell for The New York Times
item.media:description: Kevin Smith and Jason Mewes with the Buddy Christ figure featured in Smith’s 1999 film “Dogma.”

item.title: Vladimir Putin’s ‘Medea’
item.description: What does Vlad the Impaler have in store for the world?
item.dc:creator: Maureen Dowd
item.media:description: President Vladimir Putin held a ceremony Friday to declare the annexation of four regions in Ukraine.

item.title: My First Yom Kippur in Exile
item.description: When it became clear that Vladimir Putin would require me to support his war in Ukraine, I had to leave.
item.dc:creator: Pinchas Goldschmidt

item.title: There Is a Tax That Could Help With Inflation
item.description: The case for a progressive levy on consumption.
item.dc:creator: Ezra Klein
item.media:credit: Yuvraj Khanna for The New York Times

item.title: I Make Video Games. I Won’t Let My Daughters Play Them.
item.description: Parents aren’t doing enough to protect their kids from gaming addiction.
item.dc:creator: William Siu

item.title: The Supreme Court Is Broken. Where’s Biden?
item.description: Why is the president sitting this out?
item.dc:creator: Jeff Shesol

item.title: How Private High Schools Keep the College Pay-to-Win Game Going
item.description: And it can be yours for just four yearly payments of $50,000!
item.dc:creator: Sophie Callcott

item.title: Will Nostalgia Kill the British Right?
item.description: A yearning for the 1980s meets a very 21st century kind of European crisis.
item.dc:creator: Ross Douthat
item.media:description: Prime Minister Liz Truss of Britain.

item.title: Putin’s Speech Just Told Us His Ukraine War Plans
item.description: Amid the bluster and veiled threats, the president made three distinct points that form a blueprint for war and peace.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Baunov

item.title: A choice between two heavyweights
item.description: Brazil votes for president today. Jack Nicas, the bureau chief there, explains what’s at stake.
item.dc:creator: Claire Moses
item.media:credit: From left: Lalo de Almeida for The New York Times; Victor Moriyama for The New York Times
item.media:description: The challenger, former President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, left, and the incumbent, President Jair Bolsonaro. Mr. da Silva leads in the polls.

item.title: The Sunday Read: ‘The Safe Space That Became a Viral Nightmare’
item.description: An argument at Arizona State’s multicultural center spiraled into a disaster for everyone involved. Who was to blame?
item.dc:creator: Sarah Viren, Aaron Esposito, Jack D’Isidoro, John Woo, Sophia Lanman and Ted Blaisdell
item.media:credit: Philip Cheung for The New York Times
item.media:description: Clockwise from top left: Sarra Tekola, Miriam Araya, Mastaani Qureshi and Chase Beckerman.

item.title: Billion-dollar disasters
item.description: Hurricane Ian is all but certain to join a growing list of very costly storms.
item.dc:creator: Somini Sengupta
item.media:credit: Johnny Milano for The New York Times
item.media:description: San Carlos Island in Fort Myers Beach, Fla., on Thursday.

item.title: TikTok’s Corn Kid Is Doing Just Fine: The Week in Narrated Articles
item.description: Five articles from around The Times, narrated just for you.
item.media:credit: OK McCausland for The New York Times
item.media:description: A video of Tariq took off online when he shared his love of corn.

item.title: Mystery Solved: ‘Dateline’ Finds Path From TV to Podcast Stardom
item.description: The true crime storytelling that has done so well for so long on television seems to have met a moment in an entirely new medium.
item.dc:creator: John Koblin
item.media:credit: Alex Welsh for The New York Times
item.media:description: Dateline host Keith Morrison at his home in Newport Coast, California in September, 2022.

item.title: Health Insurance Guide: Navigating Coverage in Your 20s
item.description: Whether you’re turning 26 and about to age out of a parent’s plan or just landing a job with benefits, finding coverage is a tricky task.
item.dc:creator: Isabella Simonetti
item.category: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
item.media:credit: Tim Gruber for The New York Times
item.media:description: “I decided to go with the lower-paying option with the expectation that I wouldn’t need as much care and would likely be better off,” said Cal Treichler, who bought his own insurance when he turned 26 this year.

item.title: The Great Guinea Pig Giveaway Has Begun
item.description: From geckos to chinchillas, small pets were a pandemic balm. Now shelters across the country say they are being surrendered.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Maslin Nir
item.category: American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals
item.media:credit: Natalie Keyssar for The New York Times
item.media:description: Liliana Bravo, an adoption supervisor at a New York City animal shelter, holds one of the many guinea pigs to be surrendered in recent weeks. The City Council is considering a bill that would ban their sale in pet shops.

item.title: F.D.A. Moves to Change ‘Healthy’ Food Definition
item.description: Salmon is in; sugary yogurt is out.
item.dc:creator: Dani Blum
item.media:credit: Sara Hylton for The New York Times

item.title: How to Strengthen Your Bones and Reduce Osteoporosis Risk
item.description: A new study predicts hip fractures will nearly double worldwide by 2050. Here’s how to avoid them.
item.dc:creator: Melinda Wenner Moyer

item.title: Hair Loss After Covid: What to Know
item.description: Increased shedding after illness is not unusual. The good news is that it’s most likely temporary.
item.dc:creator: Knvul Sheikh

item.title: Watch Billy Eichner and Luke Macfarlane on an Awkward Date in ‘Bros’
item.description: The director Nicholas Stoller narrates a sequence from the romantic comedy.
item.dc:creator: Mekado Murphy

item.title: How to Solve Intermediate Crosswords
item.description: Moving up to the Wednesday and Thursday puzzles.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Frere and Isaac Aronow
